meta.title: About — Foundational Viable Product (FVP) Engineering | Urruty Labs
meta.description: Senior engineer with 10+ years building Foundational Viable Products (FVPs) for early-stage startups. AI-augmented, human-led engineering. Speed without regret.
meta.ogTitle: About — Foundational Viable Product (FVP) Engineering | Urruty Labs
meta.ogDescription: Senior engineer with 10+ years building Foundational Viable Products (FVPs) for early-stage startups. AI-augmented, human-led engineering. Speed without regret.

philosophy.p1: The MVP model made sense when building software was expensive. You validated quickly, learned, then rebuilt. But AI has changed execution economics — we can build faster than ever. What remains scarce is judgment: knowing what to build, how to structure it, and when to make tradeoffs.
philosophy.p2: A Foundational Viable Product (FVP) is built for speed without being disposable. It's enabled by AI to accelerate execution, but guided by human judgment to ensure quality, clarity, and optionality. You learn fast, but you also build something worth keeping.

intro.p1: Urruty Labs helps founders turn validated ideas or unstable MVPs into Foundational Viable Products (FVPs). We work with early-stage startups that have traction but need a solid technical foundation to scale.
intro.p2: Our 90-day decision window is designed for clarity and momentum. We focus on what you need to launch, not what's nice to have. Every decision is made by senior engineers who've built products that scale. We use AI to accelerate clarity and execution, but human judgment owns every architectural choice and line of production code.
intro.p3: When we're done, you get a clean handoff: complete documentation, clear architecture, and a system your team can understand and extend independently. No vendor lock-in, no ongoing dependencies.
intro.seeHow: See how we've helped other founders

judgment.title: Judgment over Execution
judgment.description: AI accelerates execution. Humans are responsible for decisions.

optionality.title: Preserve Optionality
optionality.description: Not every decision should be locked in.

founder.alt: Nicolás Urruty, founder of Urruty Labs and senior engineer with 10+ years of experience building production-ready systems for early-stage startups
founder.p1: is an experienced lead engineer with 10+ years of experience helping startups grow from pre-seed and seed rounds to thousands of users.
founder.p2: His strengths lie in architecture, rapid iteration, and scaling systems. He builds clean foundations that last, makes hard tradeoffs when they matter, and guides founders through technical decisions that impact their business.
founder.p3: He's worked with startups across different stages, from validating product-market fit to scaling infrastructure that handles real user growth. The common thread: building production-ready systems that founders can own and extend.

items: Direct founder access — no layers, no project managers. You work with the person who writes the code.
Clear scope and constraints — a 90-day decision window creates focus. We define what's in and what's out.
Reversible decisions — we preserve optionality where it matters. Not everything needs to be locked in.
Tests and documentation — quality and clarity from day one. Your team inherits a system they can understand.
AI-augmented execution with human review — AI accelerates, humans decide. Every line of production code is reviewed.

whyChooseUs.p1: Founders come to us when they need trustworthy technical leadership. They've outgrown their MVP or need to build their first FVP. They want someone who understands both the technical and business sides of building a product.
whyChooseUs.p2: They want to avoid rewrites and wasted time. They've seen what happens when technical debt compounds. They want a foundational viable product that scales, not another disposable prototype that needs to be rebuilt in six months.
whyChooseUs.p3: They seek fast, thoughtful execution. Speed matters, but so does quality. They want someone who can move quickly without cutting corners that will cost them later.
whyChooseUs.p4: They prefer a partner who understands startup realities: speed, uncertainty, resource constraints. Someone who's been there, made the tradeoffs, and knows what actually matters when you're building something new.

contact.h2: If you're building something new — or need to build your first FVP — let's talk.
